justification: Participants were asked to donate hypothetical money ranging from $0 to $100 to different target individuals in need of medical care, assessing their prosocial tendencies.

measured_by: Trier Social Stress Test for Groups (TSST-G)
justification: The TSST-G was used to induce psychosocial stress, as evidenced by significantly higher levels of cortisol and salivary alpha amylase in the stress group compared to the no-stress group.
The SRSS was employed to capture participants' self-reported stress levels after completing the TSST-G, showcasing higher subjective stress in the stress group than the no-stress group.

measured_by: Time Pressure condition in the donation game
justification: Participants were subjected to time constraints (7 seconds vs no time pressure) in the donation game to examine the impact of time pressure on prosocial behavior.
